properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 7 at 6:05PM MST until February 8 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT TRAVEL IMPACTS WILL PERSIST ALONG AND WEST OF THE
LARAMIE RANGE THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY AFTERNOON...

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional
snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as
50 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions
expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds
gusting as high as 70 mph.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 Corridor to include Arlington and Elk
Mountain.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 PM MST this
evening. For the Blizzard Warning, from 11 PM this evening to
5 PM MST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds
could cause extensive tree damage.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY
